intro: Secamone angustifolioides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved secamone, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and prominent stamens, making it visually striking. It is often found in dry woodlands and rocky areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
